channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London Perl and Raku Workshop
item.description: October 26, 2024, in London, UK

item.title: Purdue Perl Mongers
item.description: October 09, 2024, Virtual event

item.title: Boston.pm monthly meeting
item.description: October 8, 2024, Virtual event

item.title: Toronto Perl Mongers monthly meeting
item.description: September 26, 2024, Virtual event

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Week 286 - Self Spammer & Order Game
item.description: Clever recursive function is not a bad choice, to be honest. I liked the implementation too, keep it up great work.

item.title: Quines are boring, but generative AI still can't do my job
item.description: Story telling format is one of my favourite and this is exactly what I like. It is worth checking, you really don't want to skip.

item.title: The Game of Order
item.description: CPAN can never let you down, if you know what you are looking for. Here we found another gem function that takes all the work load. Highly recommended.

item.title: To The Weekly Challenge #286
item.description: Nice breakdowm of task into easy to understand action. The end result is short and crispy. Cool, keep it up.

item.title: PWC 286
item.description: Interesting take on interpreted and compiled languages trying to find the program source. Enough to keep you busy, great work.

item.title: My word - and min max
item.description: CPAN can be handy when you struggle to find the quick solution. How? Please checkout the post.

item.title: Spammer Game
item.description: Blogging is a special skill and here you get to see it yourself. Technical blog can be fun too. Well done.

item.title: The Random Spammer Testing Game
item.description: Loved the detailed implementation knowledge, it makes the reading so easy to follow. Great work, keep it up.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286
item.description: This week we got more than what we asked. I really enjoyed the variation. Thanks for your contributions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286: Order Game
item.description: Over the time, we noticed the translation of Raku into Perl but this week we got the bonus Perl to Raku port. Brilliant, thanks for sharing.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286: Self Spammer
item.description: Lots of Perl and Raku magic in display this week. Plenty to keep you busy, thanks for your contributions.

item.title: Randomly Extremal
item.description: Don't you love the rule breakers? I love them as it make the game more interesting. Hihgly recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 286
item.description: This is for both Perl and Raku fans. You get to see the flavour of both and implementation too. Keep sharing knowledge with us.

item.title: Not Quite a Quine
item.description: Do you miss code review? I do a lot. Thanks to the post this week, I got a glimpse of it. Thank you for your efforts.

item.title: Self Order
item.description: Raku magic once again showing the power of one-liner. Thanks for sharing knowledge with us every week.

item.title: TWC286
item.description: Master of compact and readable Perl code. Incredible, keep it up great work.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 286
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Self Spammer" and "Order Game" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 287
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Strong Password" and "Valid Number". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: TPRC 2024 after action report
item.description: We now have feedback for TPRC 2024 as shared by TPF.

item.title: Dates and location have been set for TPRC 2025!
item.description: For all Perl and Raku fans, the venue for TPRC 2025 is declared finally.

item.title: #686 - Perl Conference
item.description:
Hi there,

Talking about conference, I would like to share a big announcement about The Perl and Raku Conference 2025. It was a big surprise for me. I hope and wish this time, it would be a big crowd puller for both attendees and sponsors. We even have the action report of TPRC 2024 as shared by TPF. Plenty of interesting results came out of it.

Well, if we are talking conference then how can we miss the long awaiting London Perl & Raku Conference 2024. It is going strong as we are approaching the event. A gentle reminder to myself to get my slides ready for my talk. I am super excited to meet my heroes in person.

Last but not least, you please take care of your health. Enjoy rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
